H0.text: who destroyed the first temple and exiled the two tribes of judah to babylon. Sennacherib

H1.text: who destroyed the first temple and exiled the two tribes of judah to babylon. Tiglath-Pileser III

H2.text: who destroyed the first temple and exiled the two tribes of judah to babylon. Esarhaddon

H3.text: who destroyed the first temple and exiled the two tribes of judah to babylon. Nebuchadnezzar

A4.text: In 587 BC Nebuchadnezzar besieged Jerusalem and destroyed it and the Kingdom of Judah, deporting much of its population in what became known as the Babylonian captivity.

A5.text: The Babylonian captivity initiated by Nebuchadnezzar came to an end with the fall of Babylon to the Achaemenid king Cyrus the Great in 539 BC.
